title: pakhitheboss
author: pakhitheboss
content: Coinbase just launched a new marketing campaign on Twitter by dropping a New Bitcoin advert. It is pretty good as it highlights some of the biggest flaws of the US financial system. If you have not watched it then you can view it here.

comments.author: dzungmobile
comments.body: Nothing is interesting with me.Centralized governments, centralized banks won't change. They cooperate with each other to make inflation and cause loss of purchasing power of fiat currencies [1]Why Coinbase don't change themselves first from a centralized platform to a decentralized one?  [1] https://www.visualcapitalist.com/purchasing-power-of-the-u-s-dollar-over-time/

comments.author: Darker45
comments.body: I think it's pretty awesome. And while it is paid by Coinbase, it is obviously not an advertisement of Coinbase but of Bitcoin. Of course, Bitcoin doesn't cease processing transactions all over the world. It doesn't rest. It doesn't have a holiday and can't be shut down. Coinbase, of course, is the opposite.I also think it's wise to promote Bitcoin not only by presenting Bitcoin and its revolutionary features but also by making people realize the kind of system they are currently in, particularly emphasizing that they deserve better. The ad is kind of enlightening, showing the why of Bitcoin. Some might find no reason to get into Bitcoin without being presented with how rotten the fiat system is. But in countries like Lebanon, Argentina, Venezuela, Zimbabwe, Nigeria, and many others, even China with its funny CBDC that has an expiry date, they're the best promoters of Bitcoin.

comments.author: thecodebear
comments.body: I mean it would have been better if they even once mentioned Bitcoin lol. It was a Coinbase ad not a Bitcoin ad. If it was a Bitcoin ad they would have mentioned it. I was waiting at the end for it to say something like Use Bitcoin but it just said Coinbase

comments.author: Oasisman
comments.body: Technically, it wasn't really a Bitcoin advertisement, it's a Coinbase advertisement. The good thing about it is it highlights the flaws in the traditional banking system and the flaws of 3rd party payment processors. So, basically this is where cryptocurrency takes place not only Bitcoin, but crypto as a whole, and of course using their platform to make those transactions. Nevertheless, the advertisement really made sense though, but we all know people who doesn't want to learn and correct these flaws, would never gonna switch and leave what their used to.

comments.author: Die_empty
comments.body: Quote from: dzungmobile on March 10, 2023, 03:07:32 AMNothing is interesting with me.Centralized governments, centralized banks won't change. They cooperate with each other to make inflation and cause loss of purchasing power of fiat currencies [1]Why Coinbase don't change themselves first from a centralized platform to a decentralized one?  [1] https://www.visualcapitalist.com/purchasing-power-of-the-u-s-dollar-over-time/I think it is a win-win situation for both coinbase and decentralization. Exposing the problems of conventional banking will positively affect the crypto industry. Coinbase wants to attract more customers to its platform with this advert which might make them carry out business transactions on its platform. Some of these customers might also later discover the imperfections of a centralized platform like Coinbase and move to embrace decentralized wallets. People need to be aware of these parasites called banks and that's what this advert is trying to depict. The conventional banking system is gradually drowning people slowly and most people lack the knowledge of available alternatives.

comments.author: xSkylarx
comments.body: I laughed so hard at the "next window" part and also at the 5 business days to deliver your money. But it was not really straight forward about bitcoin or cryptocurrency; they are really promoting coinbase it's their platform, and part of this is the bitcoin. It's a fun advertisement, but it's the sad truth, and changing it is difficult because it's backed by the government, and because of its flaws, people can exploit it more mostly those powerful.

comments.author: Artemis3
comments.body: Quote from: pakhitheboss on March 10, 2023, 02:02:06 AMCoinbase just launched a new marketing campaign on Twitter by dropping a New Bitcoin advert. It is pretty good as it highlights some of the biggest flaws of the US financial system. If you have not watched it then you can view it here.  There is no Bitcoin there, only Coinbase is mentioned. An exchange is NOT Bitcoin. Bitcoin is paying and being paid bitcoins, p2p wallet to wallet, no exchanges, no 3rd parties, no banks, no State, no financial system. Heck, Bitcoin doesn't ask you KYC unlike this exchange...

comments.author: Gayong88
comments.body: Coinbase's marketing strategy has succeeded in attracting widespread attention to their services. It is generally known that today's payment technology leaves a lot to be desired and the biggest obstacle with Bitcoin is that it is possible to make payments without a third party. because with Bitcoin you can fully control your finances.However for online merchants it may be a different story as it means they have to charge their customers more to cover their transaction costs. These are all problems that can be solved with blockchain-based solutions, which of course include Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies. Let the free market decide...

comments.created_time: March 10, 2023, 08:00:57 AMLast edit: March 10, 2023, 11:50:04 AM by Asuspawer09
comments.body: Quote from: pakhitheboss on March 10, 2023, 02:02:06 AMCoinbase just launched a new marketing campaign on Twitter by dropping a New Bitcoin advert. It is pretty good as it highlights some of the biggest flaws of the US financial system. If you have not watched it then you can view it here.  Interestingly, the advertisement was great and it seems like coinbase is talking about cryptocurrency not directly about bitcoin but still talking about shady things like fees, transactions, atm, banks, etc. which is I think a great move introducing a new system like cryptocurrency avoiding this kind of things would probably attract a lot of users to buy cryptocurrency.It could still introduce a lot of users into cryptocurrency at least even though most of us hate coinbase and doesn't really recommend coinbase because it's still a centralized exchange, but the ads could be better if they could somehow show a glimpse of the bitcoin logo there or maybe any cryptocurrency. This was probably one of the best ads of coinbase, hopefully, coinbase could start something that could support their users when it comes to decentralization, the fact it is a centralized exchange just completely discourages a lot of users as well as high fees.
